noun.description: A genus of Gram-positive, aerobic actinomycetes whose members typically form mycelia that tend to fragment into rod-shaped or coccoid elements, and are widely distributed in soil and water, sometimes acting as (usually opportunistic) pathogens of humans and other animals.

origin: Early 20th century. From scientific Latin Nocardia from the name of Edmond I. E. Nocard, French veterinary pathologist + -ia.
